#Text=Diving in South Australia/Shark cage diving at the Neptune Islands
#Text=The dive site Neptune Islands is an offshore site located close to the mouth of Spencer Gulf in South Australia .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Neptune Islands is the only location in Australia where shark cage diving can be legally conducted .
#Text=Tours to the site depart by charter boat from Port Lincoln on Eyre Peninsula .
#Text=Position
#Text=North Neptune Island S35°23.0 ’ E136°06.00 ’
#Text=South Neptune Island
#Text=Shark cage diving is conducted at a number of sites within two protected areas around each of the two groups of islands .
#Text=A permit is required to enter the protected area and will be arranged by the Tour Operator as part of the charter service .
#Text=Name
#Text=The site name " Neptune Islands " is derived from the name of the islands as given by the British explorer , Matthew Flinders on Sunday 21 February 1802 .
#Text=Depth
#Text=Cage
#Text=moored at surface - 2.0 m ,
#Text=Cage on seabed - 18.0 m
#Text=Facilities
#Text=Permanent amenities at the site are non-existent .
#Text=The tour operator 's vessel will provide ablution facilities , changing rooms , fresh drinking water , and food .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Access to the site is via boat which departs from Port Lincoln .
#Text=Photography

#Text=For surface cage dives , wide-angle is recommended while strobe may be useful for infill lighting , remembering that the maximum water depth is about 2 m. For cage dives on the seabed , both wide-angle and artificial illumination ( i.e. a strobe or photo lighting ) are recommended .
#Text=At the surface ( i.e. the decks of the charter vessels ) , lenses with telephoto capacity are recommended for portraits of sharks .
#Text=Suggested Routes
#Text=Given the risks associated with Great White Sharks , guests are not allowed to exit the cages .
#Text=Hazards
#Text=Do not extend any part of the body outside of the cage or attempt to touch sharks .
#Text=Skills
#Text=For surface cage diving , no prior training is required as all three operators will conduct this activity as a resort dive using surface-supplied breathing air .
#Text=Rodney Fox Shark Expeditions who offers cage dives in cages lowered to the seabed will require an entry-level certification such as CMAS 1 Star Diver or PADI Open Water Diver .
#Text=Equipment
#Text=Adventure Bay Charters and Calypso Star Charter will provide all equipment required for surface cage diving including masks and wetsuits .
#Text=Rodney Fox Shark Expeditions will hire equipment to guests who do not choose to bring their own equipment .
#Text=It is recommended that any special equipment needs be discussed at the time of booking .
#Text=Sunglasses with polarised lenses offer a real advantage for spotting sharks approaching under the surface glare on the water .
#Text=This advice also applies for polarized filters on topside camera lenses .
#Text=Back to Diving in South Australia#Eyre Peninsula
